- Amelia Earhart's achievements as a pilot:
- First woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean
- First woman to fly solo from Hawaii to California
- First person to fly solo from Los Angeles to Mexico City
- First woman to fly solo from Mexico City to New York City

- First woman to fly solo from Bangkok to Singapore
- First woman to fly solo from Singapore to Manila
- First woman to fly solo from Manila to Hong Kong
- First woman to fly solo from Hong Kong to Shanghai
- First woman to fly solo from Shanghai to Tokyo
- First woman to fly solo from Tokyo to Oakland, California

- Amelia Earhart's achievements as an explorer:
- First woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean

- Amelia Earhart's achievements as a writer:
- Author of the book "20 Hrs., 40 Min."
- Author of the book "The Fun of It"
- Author of the book "Last Flight"

- Amelia Earhart's achievements as a lecturer:
- Lectured on aviation and exploration throughout the United States and Europe
- Spoke at the World's Fair in Chicago in 1933
- Spoke at the National Geographic Society in Washington, D.C. in 1935

- Amelia Earhart's achievements as a role model:
- Inspired generations of women to pursue careers in aviation and exploration
- Was a symbol of courage, determination, and adventure
- Was a pioneer for women's rights
